properties.title: Installing Hippo CMS Document Commenting Plugin

section.name: Installing Hippo CMS Document Commenting Plugin

subsection.name: Add Dependencies
subsection.p: Make sure you have the forge Maven2 repository reference and dependency definition in the root pom.xml of your project.

div.source:
<repositories>
<!-- SNIP -->
<repository> <id>hippo-maven2-forge</id> <name>Hippo Maven 2 Forge repository</name> <url>http://maven.onehippo.com/maven2-forge/</url> <snapshots /> </repository>
<!-- SNIP -->
</repositories>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependencyManagement>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
<!-- NOTE: You should set a property named 'doc-commenting.version' to a version of this plugin! --> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.doc-commenting</groupId> <artifactId>doc-commenting-repository</artifactId> <version>${doc-commenting.version}</version> </dependency>
<dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.doc-commenting</groupId> <artifactId>doc-commenting-cms</artifactId> <version>${doc-commenting.version}</version> </dependency>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencyManagement>

subsection.p: And add the following dependency reference into your Hippo CMS Web Application module subproject.
Now, you're ready to use the plugin!

subsection.name: Security Domain Configuration
subsection.p: This plugin stores comment data in JCR node structure by default (using DefaultJcrCommentPersistenceManager). The default CommentPersistenceManager requires the user to be able to write doccommenting-commentdatacontainer and doccommenting:commentdata nodes under /doccommentdata node.

Therefore, you should add Hippo Security Domain configurations under /hippo:configuration/hippo:domains/ like the following (in System View XML format), in order to allow users in both 'author' and 'editor' group to be able to read/write the comment data nodes, for instance:
